Katy Perry pulls from People's Choice Awards

Katy Perry has pulled out from the People's Choice awards inside the wake of her split from Russell Brand.

The 'Firework' singer has canceled her planned appearance with the ceremony Wednesday night, which would have been her first public appearance since Russell filed for divorce on December 30, ending their 14-month union.

She wrote on twitter: "Unfortunately I cannot be able to attend the People's Choice Awards. I wish to thank u all for voting for me personally, fingers crossed! (sic)"

Katy, 27, increased for seven awards at the ceremony, including Favorite Female Artist.

Following the couple announced no more their marriage, Russell's invite towards the show was withdrawn to avoid the possibility of an awkward meeting together.

Meanwhile, Russell is getting in the split by going to watch his favorite team West Ham United.

The 'Arthur' star has taken an extended holiday following the Christmas period and is spending his spare time going to watch the east London club play numerous games as possible.

A source told The Sun newspaper: "Russell looks forward to catching up with old friends and watching West Ham. He had been a regular face in the home games and also put in the miles attending away matches. He can't wait to have stuck in again."

However, staying at the ground could restore bittersweet memories for Russell, 36, while he could be reminded of times Katy made 12 costume changes at the MTV European Music Awards in '09, including wearing a bespoke burlesque West Ham lingerie group of basque and pants, while using team's badge on each breast and the nickname 'Rusty' written across her butt.
